material.mattext: Find the probability distribution of X. In other words, list the possible value that X can get, and their corresponding probabilities. (Hint: There are three possibilities here: no fire, total loss due to fire, 50% damage due to fire).

There are three possibilities that correspond to the three possible values of X in this example. In any case, the insurance company is gaining to the policy cost, which is $1350. * If there is total loss due to fire (which happens with probability .002), the insurance company has to pay the customer $100,000, and therefore the company's gain is: $1350-$100,000. * If there is 50% damage due to fire (which happens with probability .008), the insurance company has to pay the customer $50,000, and therefore the company's gain is: $1350-$100,000. * If there is no fire (which must happen with the "remaining probability" of 1-.002-.008=.99), the insurance company has to pay nothing and so is left with the premium gain of $1350.
